mprApartmentBuildingLayout.Description1: Service for automatic recalculation of apartment areas when the size of the rooms changes
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd1: Entered manually! Participates in all basic algorithms of Apartment Layout
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd5: Room Type. Assigned by room matrix
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd6: Number of living rooms in the apartment
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd7: Apartment area rounded to a given sign
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd8: The area of the apartment room rounded to a given sign. With a reduction factor
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd9: Reduction factor for balcony, loggia, terrace
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd10: The thickness of the rough finish used in calculating the areas, in mm
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd11: The order number of the same-name rooms in the apartment
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd12: The sum of the living room areas of the apartment
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd13: The sum of the areas of the apartment without taking into account unheated rooms (Total)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd14: The sum of all areas of the apartment. Including unheated with a reduction factor (Reduced)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd14-1: The sum of all areas of the apartment without taking into account the reduction factor
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd15: The sum of the areas of unheated rooms of the apartment. Without reduction factors
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd16: The sum of the areas of unheated rooms of the apartment. With a reduction factor
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd17: Auxiliary parameter that allows you to count the number of apartments in the schedules
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd18: To be completed at the end of the project
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd19: Levels count of a multilevel apartment
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.pd20: Additional parameter that allows to designate the room as Mezzanine room
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.h13: Specify which room area – rounded or rounded with factor – to use when calculating the total areas of the apartment
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.h38: Specify the starting row from which to start reading the data, as well as the column numbers that contain the values for the specified properties

mprApartmentBuildingLayout.h66: No apartments were found for calculation! Fill in the room parameters "Functional purpose" and "Name" according to the room matrix, and then do the apartment collection
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.h70: Use the Shift key and/or the Ctrl key to select more than one item in the list.
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.h81: Service for automatic recalculation of apartment areas when the size of the rooms changes and a service for complete recalculation (parameterization by matrix, area recalculation and apartment type determination) when the rooms are deleted. The services process only rooms with filled "Apartment ID" parameter

mprApartmentBuildingLayout.h84: All rooms on the current view are valid
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.h86: Saves the current parameter mapping as default values. When you run the plugin in a new document in which no parameter mapping is configured, the saved default values will be substituted (if there are parameters in the document)

mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt1: The value of the "Functional purpose" parameter, which is used to select the rooms to be processed. If the parameter has a different value, the room will be skipped during the operation of all algorithms
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt3: For each group in the list, select the room in the project, which will be used to determine the initial apartment for numbering
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt4: List of allowed values for the "Functional purpose" parameter. This list is used to exclude from the initial check the rooms whose "Functional purpose" parameter value does not correspond to the apartment identifier and is not contained in the room matrix
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt5: In order to collect the apartments correctly, it is necessary to select all the rooms that should be included in the apartments
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt6: To calculate the apartments, just select at least one room in the apartment. The apartments will be collected according to the value of the "Apartment ID" parameter
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt7: The value of the "Housing" parameter will be added to the apartment number as a prefix, separated by a hyphen
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt8: The value of the "Section" parameter will be added to the apartment number as a prefix, separated by a hyphen
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt9: The value of the selected parameter will be added to the apartment number as a prefix, separated by a hyphen, in the case that the parameter has the value and the value is the same for all rooms of the apartment
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt10: Adding new positions to the current table, collected from the rooms of the current project. Items are added only with a filled "Room name" value
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt11: Merge the selected apartments in the list into one
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt12: Value used as a delimiter when adding a "Housing", "Section" and/or parameter value to the number
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt13: Select and show the checked apartments
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt14: The calculation of the apartment areas was not performed due to the presence of critical errors
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt15: Lock selected apartments. The rooms of blocked apartments will not be processed in subsequent apartment collections
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt15_1: Lock the selected apartments. The rooms of locked apartments will not be processed during further collections and calculations of apartments
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt20: Select and show all problem rooms
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt22: Merge the apartments selected in the list into one apartment. Only apartments with the same functional purpose can be merged
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt23: Add the selected rooms to the selected apartment. The apartment and the room must have the same functional purpose
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt24: For example, the original room area is 3.48. Rounding of areas is 0.1. Coefficient 0.5.
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt25: If you select the "Rounded area" option, first the rounded area will be calculated - 3.5, the result will be multiplied by a factor - 3.5 * 0.5 = 1.75, and then rounded - 1.8.
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt26: If you select the "Original area" option, the original area will be multiplied by a factor - 3.48 * 0.5 = 1.74 and then rounded up - 1.7.
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt27: This apartment is locked: the apartment rooms will not be processed when collecting apartments
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt29: The room will be removed from the apartment. All room parameters will be cleared (string parameters) or reset to zero (numeric parameters)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt30: Perform calculation of selected apartments with current settings and sources. The calculated apartments will additionally be displayed on the "Calculate apartments" tab
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt31: The number of rooms of the apartment has been changed! It is required to recalculate the apartment
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt32: All apartment room parameters will be cleared (string parameters) or reset to zero (numeric parameters)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt33: Create a new table of classification conditions
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt35: To classify the apartments, just select at least one room in the apartment. The apartments will be collected according to the value of the "Apartment ID" parameter
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.tt38: Incorrect value. Check the conditions in brackets
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction1: All rooms in the project must have the shared parameters specified in this list. You can use your own shared parameters of the same type (specified in parentheses). Specify your own shared parameters in the list or click the "Create missing parameters" button. All numeric parameters are represented by the "Currency" type, which allows to process rooms in groups
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction1_1: Additional parameters are processed and filled only if the rooms have these parameters. You can use your own shared parameters of the same type (specified in parentheses). Specify your own shared parameters in the list or click the "Create missing parameters" button
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction2: In the room matrix the basic properties for the selection of the processed rooms, the numbering of rooms in the apartment, as well as the values for the calculation of the apartment areas are set. The values from the matrix are selected by matching the functional purpose (FN column) and the room name. In the "Room name" column you can specify an asterisk at the end of the name, which will indicate a check for a match at the beginning of the room name (for example, the value "Bedroom*" will match the room names "Bedroom 1", "Bedroom 2", etc.)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction2_1: This table specifies the data used to define the apartment type. The values "Contains rooms" and " Not contains rooms" are filled in with the names of rooms, separated by semicolons (;)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction2_2: The list specifies mapping of floors and typical floors. If a typical floor is specified for a floor, then when collecting and calculating apartments, all parameters of rooms located on the specified floor will be taken from the corresponding room located on the typical floor. The room of a typical floor is defined by a vertical ray passed through the insertion point of the processed room. Floors can be defined both by level names and by level elevations
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction2_3: This table specifies the data used to define the type of apartment. The conditions "Contains rooms" and "Does not contain rooms" are filled with room names separated by semicolons (;). It is possible to complete the room names with a condition to check the area and/or a condition to check that the room is a mezzanine. To do this, enter the condition and the area value in brackets after the room name and/or comma separated condition to check if the room is a mezzanine, if necessary. The available conditions are equal (=), not equal (!=), greater than (>), greater than or equal to (>=), less than (<), less than or equal to (<=). For the "Mezzanine" check, add a comma separated "m" to set the condition "The room must be a mezzanine" or "nm" to set the condition "The room must not be a mezzanine". You can set the condition to only check "Mezzanine" without checking the area. Examples: "Kitchen (>10); Bedroom", "Pantry (<5,m)", "Pantry (nm)"
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction3: The initial check includes two parts: a check for unplaced rooms and a check for the occupancy of the parameters "Functional purpose" and "Name". If the value of the "Functional purpose" parameter corresponds to the value of the "Apartment Identifier" specified in the settings, then the "Name" parameter will be checked against the current room matrix
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction4: The apartments are collected through the geometric characteristics of the rooms, taking into account the connection of the rooms through windows, doors and room separators. All rooms of the same apartment are assigned the same value of the "Apartment ID" parameter. It is recommended to perform an additional visual check by creating a color scheme according to the "Apartment ID" parameter
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction5: Apartment calculation includes calculating the areas of the apartment, the number of living rooms, as well as determining the type of apartment using the "Apartment types" source. All obtained values are assigned to the parameters of the rooms included in the apartment. All apartments are defined according to the value of the "Apartment ID" parameter set at the "Collect apartments" step
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction5_1: This tab is not part of the main Apartment Typology algorithm! It is intended solely for filling the "AP_Rounded area" parameter (or the corresponding one in use) in selected rooms based on rounding settings. Use this feature only for rooms that do not match the current Functional purpose
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction6: Numbering can be done by grouping the apartments by Housings and/or Sections by enabling the corresponding options and by specifying the parameter names from which to take the value of the Housing and/or Sections. In this case, it is considered that the sections are subgroups for the housings. The "End-to-end numbering" property means that the numbering in the next group will continue, not start from the value set in the "Initial number" property. If you select the " Point " option in the "Start of numbering" property, you will need to select a room for each group of apartments
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction7: Creating apartment views is done by duplicating the current view, followed by cropping along the contour of the apartment. First of all, an attempt is made to create a crop contour considering the thickness of the enclosing walls (only for Revit 2020 and higher). If unsuccessful, an attempt is made to create a crop contour taking into account the thickest of the enclosing walls. If the crop contour is not created, the apartment contour obtained from the room boundaries will be used. If the option "Try to use apartment type as view name" is enabled, the created views will be given a name of the type "LEVEL_NAME – Apartment APARTMENT_TYPE".
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction8: The apartment editor allows you to make manual changes to the values of the apartment areas, as well as to merge multilevel apartments. When merging multilevel apartments, the areas are recalculated and the value of the "AP_Levels count" parameter is filled in. IMPORTANT: When recalculating apartments on a particular level, the parameter values of rooms belonging to the multilevel apartment, but located on another level, will not be recalculated
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction8_1: Apartments are collected regardless of the current value of the apartment identifier specified in the settings. The apartment editor allows you to make changes to the values of apartment areas, as well as to build multilevel apartments. When building multilevel apartments, the areas are recalculated and the value of the "AP_Levels count" parameter is filled in. The apartment editor also allows you to recalculate selected apartments, lock or unlock selected apartments, and delete selected apartments
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction9: Locked apartments are apartments whose rooms will not be processed when collecting apartments. Apartments are locked on the "Collecting apartments" tab. Locked apartments are displayed in the list regardless of the current value of the "Apartment Identifier" (value of the "Functional purpose" parameter)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction9_1: Locked apartments are apartments whose rooms will not be processed when collecting and calculating apartments. Locked apartments are displayed in the list regardless of the current value of the "Flats Identifier" (value of the "Functional Purpose" parameter)
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction10: Classification allows you to fill in certain parameters of apartments based on the characteristics of the apartments. First, you need to create tables with conditions on the "Conditions" tab, after which you can perform classification with the result displayed on the "Classification" tab
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction10_1: Specify the target parameter - string parameter to which the classification result will be set. The area is checked by the specified parameter of a random room of the apartment (i.e. all rooms are considered to have the same parameter value). The conditions "Contains rooms" and "Does not contain rooms" are filled with room names separated by semicolon (;). The room names can be completed with a condition to check the area and/or a condition to check that the room is a mezzanine. To do this, enter the condition and the area value in brackets after the room name and/or the condition for checking "Mezzanine" after the comma, if necessary. The available conditions are equal (=), not equal (!=), greater than (>), greater than or equal to (>=), less than (<), less than or equal to (<=). For the "Mezzanine" check, add a comma separated "m" to set the condition "The room must be a mezzanine" or "nm" to set the condition "The room must not be a mezzanine". You can set the condition to only check "Mezzanine" without checking the area. Examples: "Kitchen (>10); Bedroom", "Pantry (<5,m)", "Pantry (nm)"
mprApartmentBuildingLayout.instruction10_2: Classification is performed according to the specified condition tables from the Conditions tab. If the apartment to be checked does not fall under any row of the table conditions, the target parameter will be cleared

mprRoomColorVolume.Description: Showing the volume of rooms and spaces in color using DirectShape
mprRoomColorVolume.FullDescription: The Plugin lets you create DirectShape elements based on the volume of rooms and spaces in the model and assign different colors to the DirectShape elements you create. In the plugin window, you can group the created DirectShape elements by the value of the associated room or space parameter, and you can assign a single color to all DirectShape elements in the group
mprRoomColorVolume.h1: Changing colors is available in the full version of the plugin
mprRoomColorVolume.h2: Set random colors for all Room or Space volume views in the group
mprRoomColorVolume.h3: No source element was found for the current volume view in the model. The Room or Space has probably been deleted
mprRoomColorVolume.h5: The plugin does not work in families
mprRoomColorVolume.h9: Remove volume views without the source Room and Space
mprRoomColorVolume.h11: Parameter is not set or has no value
mprRoomColorVolume.h17: Change the color of volume views

mprRoomColorVolume.h28: Apply the graphics settings on the current view to all room volume views

mprWorldOrientation.Description: Orientation analysis for rooms through windows, doors, curtain walls in the enclosing walls
mprWorldOrientation.d1: The orientation analysis for rooms is performed for windows, doors, curtain walls. The result of the analysis can be written in the room parameter or in the windows, doors, curtain walls parameter
mprWorldOrientation.d2: The orientation analysis for elements. The result of the analysis can be written in the windows, doors and curtain walls parameter
mprWorldOrientation.v2: Write the result to a parameter of:
mprWorldOrientation.t1: Room elements do not have the "{0}" parameter, so it is not possible to fill in the analysis results

mprFloorByRoom.Description: Creating floors by contour of the rooms
mprFloorByRoom.t5: Floor type is not set! This configuration cannot be processed!
mprFloorByRoom.t9: Set the thickness value of the selected Floor type
mprFloorByRoom.t10: Copy parameter value (from room to floor):
mprFloorByRoom.t13: When leading the floor to the doorways to the full wall width consider the main room:
mprFloorByRoom.t16: The floor of the main room will be created with the lead-in to the doorway. Respectively, for a room that is defined as non-main room, no door leading into the doorway will be created. This option works only for families in the "Doors" category with filled FromRoom and ToRoom internal properties. The direction of movement in the opening is determined by the direction of the family's exterior side
mprFloorByRoom.t17: Cut solid door geometry from the floor contour
mprFloorByRoom.l1: Do not lead Floor contour into door openings
mprFloorByRoom.l2: Lead the contour to the middle of the wall
mprFloorByRoom.l3: Lead the contour to the full wall width
mprFloorByRoom.l4: Lead the contour to the specified value, mm

Respectively, for a room that is defined as non-main room, no door leading into the doorway will be created. This option works only for families in the "Doors" category with filled FromRoom and ToRoom internal properties. The direction of movement in the opening is determined by the direction of the family's exterior side
